message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IT

This paper deals with privacy concerns in location-based applications, which is a topic that falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also proposes a new definition for differential privacy that takes into account temporal correlations in location data, which is a topic that falls under the category of databases (cs.DB). The paper also proposes a new mechanism for location perturbation that achieves optimal utility, which is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper presents experiments on real-world datasets, which is a topic that falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
